content: @Mazdak Farrokhzad those new RFC labels... they have the wrong color :scream:
I'm open to suggestions...
consistent with the rustc repo?
are you really considering changing the color of all those labels?
@RalfJ I didn't find that color particularly readable; but I'll change to something adjacent? #f7e101
I just really love consistency...
dont care about the particular color, but it should be the same
@RalfJ I changed all the colors on both repos to #f7e101
There are... so many labels.
I'm afraid only @Mazdak Farrokhzad will remember what labels exist and appropriate for a given PR/issue.
@Vadim Petrochenkov true; there were a lot of RFCs to cover; -- I think you can type the thing that pops into your mind when reading the RFC and the searching functionality should give you something
since that's the way I created all of the labels
also, I do all the labeling of RFCs anyways ;)

I thought about having maybe 10-15 of them or so.
One for lexer things, one for syntax things, one for name resolution things, etc.
Not so fine-grained.
there are coarse grained labels and more fine grained ones
e.g. A-syntax covers all syntax changes

also, I do all the labeling of RFCs anyways ;)

Bus factor.
I don't think it's that hard to see what labels are appropriate honestly by looking at a few RFCs and the number of labels are similar to the rust repo
there's still a lot of stuff to label: all the issues (open & closed) and all the closed unmerged PRs
so I need to label those before tweaking the number of labels
